title: McCullers set to return, Diamondbacks still dealing with injuries
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . a dozen matinees get going at 1:05 p.m. ET, with another early tilt starting five minutes later . the Arizona Diamondbacks are already missing OF Corbin Carroll and C Gabriel Moreno and will probably take on the Miami Marlins this afternoon .

title: Miami 'weaker' but ready to 'fight' to oust PSG
content: "Futbol Americas" head coach says his team needs to play near-perfect match against PSG . MLS side face off in the club world cup round of 16 on sunday . the 5-0 demolition of inter Milan in the final of the tournament is the first UEFA title .

title: NBA free agency: Cap space, best fits for all 30 teams
content: teams across the league are shifting focus to the free agency and trade landscape . how many teams have salary cap space, and which could create some? who could follow the Boston Celtics and make cost-cutting trades to save on their luxury tax bill?

title: Which teams' drafts get an A? What about a C-? We have grades for all 30
content: my team grades for the 2025 draft are the only ones you'll read that aren't concerned with results . no team, not even the Brooklyn Nets, drafts enough players in one year . trades are also considered .

title: List of all 224 picks, plus scouting notes for every first-rounder
content: the 2025 NHL draft is taking place on friday (Round 1) and Saturday (2rounds 2-7) this page will be your home for the entire event . each pick is added below, including scouting notes and team fit analysis for the first-rounders .

title: Puri stampede: Two senior cops suspended, top officials transferred; eyewitnesses reveal big lapses
content: A deadly stampede near the Gundicha Temple in Puri during the Rath Yatra festival resulted in three fatalities and over 50 injuries. The chaos, attributed to poor crowd management and unauthorized vehicles, drew sharp criticism and prompted a government investigation. Eyewitnesses reported confusion and inadequate response, while former CM Patnaik slammed the administration's incompetence following the tragedy.

title: Rift in TMC: Kalyan Banerjee drags Moitra's personal life; takes 'honeymoon' jibe
content: Trinamool Congress MPs Kalyan Banerjee and Mahua Moitra are embroiled in another public dispute, this time over Banerjee's controversial remarks regarding the South Calcutta Law College rape case. Banerjee responded to Moitra's criticism by attacking her personal life, referencing her marriage and questioning her ethics.

title: 24-year-old Indian woman goes missing in US; had gone for arranged marriage
content: Simran Simran, a 24-year-old woman from India, has been reported missing in New Jersey just days after arriving in the US for an arranged marriage. Surveillance footage shows her alone and seemingly waiting, but not distressed.

title: ‘We’re sorry’: Newborn left outside orphanage with handwritten note
content: In Panvel, a newborn girl was discovered abandoned outside an orphanage on Saturday morning. The infant was found with a feeding bottle, food, clothes, and a note from the parents expressing regret and citing financial and mental inability to care for her. The parents indicated a potential future return.

title: Wait ends: Monsoon reaches Delhi, envelops India 9 days early
content: The monsoon arrived in Delhi on June 29, 2025, a day earlier than expected, and covered the entire country nine days ahead of schedule. This is the fastest monsoon coverage since 2020. An orange alert has been issued for several districts in Himachal Pradesh due to heavy rainfall, with warnings of potential flash floods and landslides.

title: OpenAI CEO takes one of the biggest AI U-Turn; says: Current computers are …
content: Sam Altman has shifted his stance on AI hardware, now believing new devices are essential as AI evolves, contrasting his previous view. He envisions AI systems deeply integrated into users' lives, moving beyond traditional interfaces. This change aligns with Jony Ive's arrival at OpenAI, sparking speculation about a groundbreaking AI device slated for release in late 2026.

title: 'Will I play again?: Rishabh Pant's painful question
content: Indian cricketer Rishabh Pant's remarkable recovery from a life-threatening car accident in December 2022 is truly inspiring. Orthopedic surgeon Dr. Dinshaw Pardiwala, who led Pant's treatment, revealed the extent of his injuries and the initial concerns about his ability to walk, let alone play cricket again.

title: Made videos, body-shamed girls: How 'Mango's' campus abuse was ignored for yrs
content: Manojit Mishra, accused of gang-rape, was known at his Kolkata law college for alleged abuse of power and instilling fear, particularly among women. He reportedly recorded private moments, morphed pictures, and shared them in WhatsApp groups for ridicule.

title: SoftBank founder’s prediction: Bets billions on AI company; says it will be world's most valuable\
content: SoftBank is heavily investing in OpenAI, with planned investments of $33.2 billion, as CEO Masayoshi Son envisions OpenAI becoming the world's most valuable company and a leader in artificial superintelligence. Despite Microsoft's changing relationship with OpenAI, SoftBank remains committed to supporting the AI firm's growth and its role in SoftBank's vision for the future.

title: 'Even Virat Kohli was thinking ... ': Rohit Sharma on Kohli’s mental strength
content: Reflecting on India's T20 World Cup victory, Rohit Sharma highlighted Virat Kohli's pivotal 76-run innings and his crucial partnership with Axar Patel against South Africa. Sharma emphasized Kohli's experience and composure under pressure, which anchored the innings after early wickets fell.

title: Kolkata horror: 7-hr CCTV footage under lens; 90-second assault clip found
content: Kolkata Police have formed a Special Investigation Team to investigate the gang rape of a law student on her college campus. The team is analyzing CCTV footage and technical evidence, while the survivor's medical report confirms the assault. Three suspects, including an alumnus, have been arrested, and video clippings of the crime were retrieved from their phones.

title: Did Altman lie? Ex-OpenAI engineer joining Meta on $100M signing bonus
content: Lucas Beyer, a recent Meta hire from OpenAI, refuted claims of a $100 million signing bonus, dismissing them as "fake news." This follows Sam Altman's suggestion of Meta's extravagant offers to lure talent. Meta's CTO criticized Altman's tactics as dishonest, highlighting the ongoing talent war and Meta's significant AI investments.

title: CSK star batter creates history, smashes world record on Test debut
content: In a historic Test match against Zimbabwe, South Africa witnessed remarkable debuts. Dewald Brevis smashed the fastest fifty in a debut Test innings, while Lhuan-dre Pretorius became South Africa's youngest Test centurion, surpassing a 61-year-old record. Their performances highlighted the depth of young talent and validated South Africa's strategy of nurturing emerging cricketers.

title: Telangana horror: Man sets mother on fire over financial dispute
content: In a horrifying incident in Warangal, Muttineni Satish, an alcoholic, set his mother, Muttineni Vinoda, on fire after she refused to give him more money. Vinoda sustained 80% burns and is in critical condition. Satish had been harassing his parents for money after they received compensation for their land, leading to this brutal act.

title: Iran confirms 71 killed in Israeli strike on Evin prison; top prosecutor among the dead
content: An Israeli airstrike on Tehran's Evin prison, a facility notorious for holding political prisoners, resulted in at least 71 deaths, according to Iran's judiciary. The June 23 attack, part of a broader Israeli campaign against Iranian military infrastructure, killed inmates, guards, and civilians. Among the detainees are French citizens held on espionage charges.

title: Blake Lively stops Swift from cutting her off as Kelce backs Taylor quietly
content: Blake Lively is reportedly struggling to salvage her friendship with Taylor Swift amidst the fallout from her legal issues with Justin Baldoni. As Travis Kelce distances himself from Ryan Reynolds, Lively is allegedly making desperate attempts to reconcile with Swift, even enlisting mutual friends for assistance. However, Swift's inner circle seems to be siding with her, leaving Lively's efforts uncertain.

title: Jake Paul dominates early rounds to beat Julio Cesar Chavez Jr in Anaheim
content: Jake Paul showcased a disciplined performance, securing a unanimous decision victory over Julio Cesar Chavez Jr. in their California bout. Paul's aggressive jabs and body punches established his dominance early, overcoming Chavez Jr.'s experience. Despite late fatigue, Paul absorbed counters and eyes future fights against cruiserweight titleholders Gilberto Ramirez and Badou Jack, signaling his serious ambitions in boxing.

title: IND vs ENG: 'We never gave India...' - England cricketer on team's strategy
content: Jamie Smith revealed England's ruthless strategy following their impressive victory over India in Leeds, emphasizing the importance of capitalizing on dominance. Smith highlighted the team's maturity and ability to push their limits, citing examples of extraordinary performances. He also noted the impact of belief and support within the team, which has elevated his own game.

title: Landslides cut off villages; Char Dham yatra halted: Rain wreaks havoc in U'khand; 10 points
content: A cloudburst in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi has caused significant damage, leaving workers missing and disrupting the Char Dham Yatra. The pilgrimage has been suspended for 24 hours due to heavy rain alerts and weather-related risks. Landslides have blocked the Badrinath and Yamunotri highways, stranding pilgrims and prompting urgent rescue operations by NDRF and SDRF teams.

title: Trade fallout: India's ban on Pak-origin cargo triggers spike in freight costs - Report
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, India's ban on ships carrying goods from or to Pakistan has significantly disrupted Pakistani trade. This ban, effective May 2025, has led to increased freight charges and longer shipping times, forcing importers to rely on feeder vessels. Indian agencies are actively enforcing the ban, seizing falsely declared Pakistani goods routed through third countries.

title: 'Make deal in Gaza': Trump calls for ceasefire; urges Hamas to release hostages
content: Donald Trump urged Israel and Hamas to finalize a deal for the release of hostages taken on October 7th, emphasizing the urgency of their return. This appeal follows Trump's previous call to drop the case against Netanyahu, whom he praised as a "War Hero," suggesting the legal proceedings could hinder negotiations.

title: Russia launches biggest air attack since war began, says Ukraine — 537 weapons used
content: Russia launched its largest aerial assault on Ukraine, deploying 537 aerial weapons, including drones and missiles, targeting regions across the country. Ukrainian forces reported shooting down 249 of the incoming weapons, while others were lost, likely due to electronic jamming. The extensive attack prompted Poland and allied nations to scramble aircraft to safeguard their airspace, highlighting the escalating conflict's impact.

title: Kumar Vishwas on ‘Sardaar Ji 3’ controversy: Slams Diljit Dosanjh
content: Renowned Hindi poet and former politician Kumar Vishwas recently addressed the rising criticism surrounding Diljit Dosanjh-starrer 'Sardaar Ji 3'. The film has drawn flak for featuring Pakistani actress Hania Aamir, particularly in the aftermath of the India-Pak tensions since April 2025.

title: 'I made your name': Ex-England cricketer on Tendulkar vs Kohli
content: Allan Lamb, the former England cricketer, declared Sachin Tendulkar as the best Indian batter, even placing him above Sunil Gavaskar and Virat Kohli. Lamb humorously recalls dropping Tendulkar early in his career, jokingly claiming responsibility for his success.

title: Kolkata horror: Prime accused's one-liner for every girl - 'Tui amay biye korbi?'
content: Monojit Mishra, accused of rape, displayed a history of disturbing behavior, including circulating morphed images, filming private moments, and body-shaming women. Despite multiple complaints of harassment and assault, no action was taken against him, fostering a climate of fear. Students describe him as a terror, highlighting the college's failure to address his actions due to his political connections.

title: 'Most people don't even have a 13-year career': Rohit Sharma opens up
content: Rohit Sharma reflects on India's thrilling seven-run victory over South Africa in Barbados, securing the ICC T20 World Cup after a 13-year wait. He recalls the sleepless night before the final, filled with nerves and anticipation. The tournament marked a significant farewell for legends Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli from T20s, with Rohit shining as the second-highest run-scorer.

title: Trump hails 'great victory' as 'big beautiful bill' squeezes through Senate
content: Donald Trump hailed the Senate's procedural victory for his economic package, calling it a "great victory." The bill, featuring tax cuts, spending reductions, and increased deportation funding, advances to formal debate. Trump credited Republican senators for their support, emphasizing the bill's potential to grow the economy, secure the border, and strengthen the military.

title: Dating Alcaraz? Raducanu's cheeky response at Wimbledon presser goes viral - WATCH
content: Emma Raducanu has denied rumors of a romantic relationship with Carlos Alcaraz, confirming their upcoming mixed doubles partnership at the US Open. The pair recently practiced together, with Alcaraz initiating the collaboration earlier this year. Raducanu expressed her excitement about teaming up with Alcaraz, while also focusing on her singles career after a recent loss at the Eastbourne Open.

title: 'Iran could restart uranium enrichment in months': IAEA chief's big claim
content: IAEA chief Rafael Grossi warns that Iran could resume uranium enrichment within months, despite recent US and Israeli airstrikes. While Iran doesn't currently possess nuclear weapons, unexplained uranium traces were found at undeclared sites. The IAEA lacks knowledge of the current location of Iran's enriched uranium stockpile, raising concerns about its potential use.

title: ‘Why Taylor Swift?’: MLB fans fume over popstar’s growing presence; debate erupts
content: Pop singer Taylor Swift's image appeared in Major League Baseball. FOX Sports: MLB used her photo to display a score between the Baltimore Orioles and Tampa Bay Rays. Baseball fans reacted negatively. They questioned her relevance to the sport. The Orioles celebrated their win by referencing Swift's song '22'. This action sparked debate among baseball enthusiasts.

title: Two strong earthquakes jolt Pakistan within 12 hours
content: Pakistan experienced a 4.5 magnitude earthquake on Sunday morning, following a stronger 5.2 magnitude quake earlier in the day. The recent tremor occurred at a shallow depth of 10 kilometers, increasing the potential for aftershocks and stronger ground shaking. No immediate reports of injuries or major damage have surfaced, but authorities are closely monitoring the situation.

title: Jagannath Rath Yatra: 3 dead, 50 injured in stampede near Puri’s Gundicha Temple
content: Tragedy struck during the Rath Yatra festival in Puri, India, as a stampede near the Gundicha Temple resulted in at least three fatalities and numerous injuries. Prior to the stampede, hundreds of devotees were hospitalized due to exhaustion and crowd pressure during the Rath Yatra.

title: OTD: India ended a decade of heartbreak with 2024 T20 World Cup glory
content: In 2024, Team India secured a memorable T20 World Cup victory, ending a decade-long drought in ICC knockouts. They remained unbeaten, defeating strong teams like Australia, Pakistan, and England. The final against South Africa saw India defend a total of 176, winning by seven runs.

title: Who was Saquib Nachan? ISIS-linked terror accused dies
content: Saquib Nachan, a convicted terrorist with links to ISIS, died at Safdarjung Hospital in New Delhi while undergoing treatment. Nachan, who was serving time in Tihar Jail, had been transferred to the hospital due to his deteriorating health. He was convicted for his involvement in the 2002-03 Mumbai bomb blasts and was allegedly involved in promoting ISIS activities in India.

title: Char Dham Yatra suspended for 24 hours amid heavy rain alert in Uttarakhand
content: The Char Dham Yatra in Uttarakhand has been temporarily suspended for 24 hours following severe weather warnings. Authorities have halted pilgrims in Rishikesh and other safe locations along the route. The Meteorological Department has issued a red alert for heavy rainfall across several districts. Garhwal Commissioner Vinay Shankar Pandey confirmed the suspension, emphasizing close monitoring of the situation.

title: Did Tharoor defend RSS? Here's what he said on Rahul's 'Manusmriti' charge
content: Shashi Tharoor appears to diverge from Rahul Gandhi's criticism of the RSS, acknowledging the historical context of Golwalkar's preference for Manusmriti while suggesting the RSS has evolved. This comes amid growing tensions between Tharoor and the Congress leadership, highlighted by cryptic social media posts and differing views on PM Modi's diplomacy, leading to indirect rebukes from party leaders.

title: Trump's 'big, beautiful bill' clears key hurdle in Senate
content: Senate Republicans advanced President Trump's economic package, featuring tax cuts, spending reductions, and deportation funding, through a procedural vote. The bill faces further debate and amendments, with some Republicans expressing concerns over program cuts. Elon Musk criticized the bill, warning of job losses and strategic harm, as the White House urges its passage.

title: ‘Just switching girlfriends’: Cam Newton reacts to Offset linking with Diggs’ ex
content: Cam Newton offers his perspective on the Stefon Diggs, Cardi B, and Offset situation, deeming it messy and driven by ego. He likens their actions to a childish competition, emphasizing a lack of genuine connection. Newton ultimately sides with Diggs, highlighting the financial disparity and the common male tendency to compare themselves when an ex moves on.

title: IND vs ENG: 'No brainer for India' — Clarke’s message to Gambhir
content: Following India's defeat in the first Test against England, former Australia captain Michael Clarke advocates for Kuldeep Yadav's inclusion in the second Test at Edgbaston. Clarke emphasizes Kuldeep's wicket-taking ability, suggesting India prioritizes bowlers who can secure 20 wickets. Echoing this sentiment, former England batter Nick Knight believes Kuldeep's variations could challenge England's aggressive batting.

title: Cloudburst in Uttarakhand: 8–9 workers missing at hotel site in Uttarkashi
content: A cloudburst in Baligarh, Uttarkashi district, has led to significant damage at an under-construction hotel along the Barkot-Yamunotri road. Authorities report that eight to nine workers are missing from the site. Rescue operations are underway, with teams from the SDRF, NDRF, and local police actively involved in the search.

title: 'Utterly insane': Musk takes on Trump again, slams Senate draft of 'big bill'
content: Elon Musk has strongly criticized the "Big Beautiful Bill," warning it would devastate American jobs and strategically harm the nation. He argues the bill favors outdated industries while crippling future-oriented sectors. The Senate is pushing for the bill's passage, aiming to present it to President Trump by July 4, despite concerns from various groups about its potential negative impacts.

title: 'Deserves contempt': India rejects Pakistan army's claim over Waziristan atta
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has vehemently rejected accusations from the Pakistan Army linking India to a deadly suicide bombing in North Waziristan that killed 16 soldiers. The MEA dismissed the claims as contemptible, despite the Pakistan Taliban faction claiming responsibility for the attack. The bombing, which involved an explosives-laden vehicle, also injured dozens and damaged nearby homes.

content: the Pittsburgh Pirates announces the death of 74-year-old Dave Parker . he was set to be inducted into the baseball hall of fame next month . "we are heartbroken to learn of the passing of Hall of Famer Dave Parker," a statement says .

title: Fight results: Jake Paul dominates, defeats Julio Cesar Chavez Jr.
content: the judges scored the fight 99-91, 97-93 and 98-92 . Paul defeated former heavyweight king Mike Tyson by unanimous decision in November . he is now riding a six-fight winning streak since losing a split decision to Tommy Fury .

title: Yankees announce George Costanza bobblehead giveaway for Aug. 21
content: the first 18,000 fans at the Yankees' matchup against the Boston Red Sox will receive a bobblehead of George Costanza sleeping under his desk . it coincides with "Seinfeld Night" at Yankee Stadium .
